channel.title: Subscription Expire
channel.description:
is it possible to get subscription expire details in c++
My response on KeyAuthApp.Data and KeyAuthApp.Data.Subscriptions only includes a vector with subscription name and no expire

item.title: Subscription Expire
item.dc:creator: Paul84
item.description:
So is it possible to get expire for each subscription/level?

Read full topic

item.title: Subscription Expire
item.dc:creator: Paul84
item.description:
Thanks for the reply. That only returns the expiry for one subscription

Read full topic

item.title: Subscription Expire
item.dc:creator: lIMonkieIl
item.description:
From the example on github

github.com

KeyAuth/KeyAuth-CPP-Example/blob/main/main.cpp#L111


      
    
          
  1. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n User data:");
    2. 
          
  2. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Username: ") << KeyAuthApp.data.username;
    3. 
          
  3. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n IP address: ") << KeyAuthApp.data.ip;
    4. 
          
  4. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Hardware-Id: ") << KeyAuthApp.data.hwid;
    5. 
          
  5. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Create date: ") << tm_to_readable_time(timet_to_tm(string_to_timet(KeyAuthApp.data.createdate)));
    6. 
          
  6. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Last login: ") << tm_to_readable_time(timet_to_tm(string_to_timet(KeyAuthApp.data.lastlogin)));
    7. 
          
  7. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Subscription name(s): ");
    8. 
          
  8. 	std::string subs;
    9. 
          
  9. 	for (std::string value : KeyAuthApp.data.subscriptions)subs += value + " ";
    10. 
          
  10. 	std::cout << subs;
    11. 
          
  11. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Subscription expiry: ") << tm_to_readable_time(timet_to_tm(string_to_timet(KeyAuthApp.data.expiry)));
    12. 
          
  12. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Checking session validation status (remove this if causing your loader to be slow)");
    13. 
          
  13. 	KeyAuthApp.check();
    14. 
          
  14. 	std::cout << skCrypt("\n Current Session Validation Status: ") << KeyAuthApp.data.message;
    15. 
          
  15. 	
    16. 
          
  16. 	/*
    17. 
          
  17. 	KeyAuthApp.web_login();
    18. 
          
  18. 
          
  19. 	std::cout << "\n Waiting for button to be clicked";
    20. 
          
  20. 	KeyAuthApp.button("close");
    21. 
          
  21. 	*/
    22.

Read full topic
